newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Bomber targets Sydney railway toilets.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Bomber targets Sydney railway toilets.

text.p: An unknown bomber blew up a men's toilet cubicle on a Sydney underground railway line on Thursday in the third such attack in a week, police and rail officials said.
They said no-one was injured in the attack, in which a crude explosive device tore through a cubicle wall and caused extensive damage to a row of toilets.
No-one was in the room at the time.
"It appeared to be a pretty crude type of bomb. No persons were injured and the trains continued to run throughout," said Ron Hall, a spokesman for transit authority, Cityrail.
A police spokesman said the bomb appeared to be a home-made devices and could even have been put together using instructions available on the Internet computer network.
Australian media said the bomber used plastic bottles filled with chemical accelerants or fertilisers to blow up the toilets at the St James Cityrail station.
One witness, 19-year-old shopworker Felicia Karangis, said she was walking along the platform when she heard a "fairly loud" explosion.
"Everyone was in shock," she said. "There were a few screams by women ... I was quite frightened."
Similar attacks have been made on two other Sydney railway station toilets in the past week, although causing less damage.
CityRail spokesman Hall said the authority was increasing security patrols and would be closing all toilets on its city circle and eastern suburbs lines.
